description: Logic is an indispensable tool in computer science and is used in every facet of the field. One may even argue that computers are built on top of logic (logic gates are the basic building blocks of computers). In this course, youâll learn the basics of logic in computer science (propositional logic, predicate logic, and, if time permits, temporal logic) in a rigorous, but hands-on manner. Applications covered in this course will mostly use examples from constraint programming, artificial intelligence, and software verification, but could also use examples from databases, and electronic design automation.
title: Logic in Computer Science
prerequisite: Either of the two introductory programming courses (YSC1202 Introduction to Computation and Programming for All; YSC2229 Introductory Data Structures and Algorithms (or previously YSC2204 Fundamentals of Programming)) and YSC2209 Proof (or as a co-requisite).
